required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rigorous Assessment of P. Vivax Relapses and Primaquine Efficacy for Radical Cure
clinical_study.official_title: Rigorous Assessment of P. Vivax Relapses and Primaquine Efficacy for Radical Cure

collaborator.agency: Cambodian National Centre for Parasitology Entomology and Malaria Control

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will be an open-labelled randomized clinical trial to determine therapeutic efficacy. Note that this will not be an Investigational New Drug application, as only WHO-approved drugs will be used at dosage and for conditions approved.
Eligible patients willing to participate will first be tested prior to enrolment for their G6PD status by the gold standard spectrophotometric analysis. The investigators will exclude from the study any G6PD deficient (or intermediate females) patient. Treatment allocation will be randomized between i) 7 days of artesunate (2 mg/kg/day for 7 days) alone (Arm1), ii) same artesunate regimen + 0.25 mg/kg/day 14 days of primaquine (Arm2) and iii) same artesunate regimen + 0.5 mg/kg/day 14 days of primaquine (Arm3). All patients will be relocated to a no-transmission city (Chbar Mon) to make sure they are not reinfected during the follow-up. Follow-up will be performed every 24-48h for 90 days. At the end of the follow-up period, all patients that did not receive primaquine (arm1) will be treated according to national guidelines (14 days at 0.25mg/kg/day). Patients will additionally be followed monthly for three months after the end of the relocation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study will be an open-labelled randomized clinical trial to determine therapeutic efficacy.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients experiencing recurrence as measured by microscopy and PCR and time to recurrence
Gene expression or serological markers associated with P. vivax recurrence

secondary_outcome.measure: Genotypes of relapsing P. vivax parasites
secondary_outcome.description: Genotypes of relapsing P. vivax parasites

arm_group.description: Enrolled patients will only received blood stage antimalarial (artesunate at 2 mg/kg per day every 24h for 7 days)
Enrolled patients will received blood stage antimalarial (artesunate at 2 mg/kg per day every 24h for 7 days) and primaquine at 0.25 mg/kg/day for 14 days (starting at day 7)
Enrolled patients will received blood stage antimalarial (artesunate at 2 mg/kg per day every 24h for 7 days) and primaquine at 0.50 mg/kg/day for 14 days (starting at day 7)

intervention.description: After treatment of the blood stage infection, enrolled participants will receive either no primaquine, a low dose of primaquine or a high dose of primaquine against liver parasites
All enrolled participants will receive a 7-day treatment of artesunate ((2 mg/kg/day) to clear blood-stage parasites

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 15 and older
- Acute (within 10 days), symptomatic (i.e., history of fever), uncomplicated malaria caused solely by Plasmodium vivax (verified by PCR)
- G6PD normal (as determined by quantitative spectrophotometric assay)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant, planning to become pregnant or lactating women,
- Received antimalarial drugs in the past month,
- Hb < 8g/dL, < 1,500 neutrophils/μl, or signs of complicated malaria (e.g., vomiting, convulsions,…),
- History of primaquine, artesunate or artesunate-mefloquine allergy or intolerance,
- PCR-positivity for SARS-CoV-2.
